subject: Technology
title: The TV Antenna Era
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The TV Antenna Era.

hook.text: Rabbit ears on top of your TV and someone yelling 'hold it there!' while adjusting the antenna. Everyone over 40 remembers.

buildup.text: Early TV signals traveled through the air from broadcast towers to home antennas. Signal quality depended entirely on location.

discovery.text: People on hilltops got clear pictures. People in valleys got static. Entire neighborhoods argued about who had better reception.

twist.text: You only got three to five channels: ABC, CBS, NBC, and maybe PBS. The entire country watched the same shows.

climax.text: Limited channels created a shared culture. Tens of millions watched the same program at the same time. That era is gone.

punchline.text: When everyone watched the same channels, the nation had a shared conversation.

quiz.question: How many channels did most Americans receive during the antenna era?
